means: physical unit table 物理部件表
product under test 被测产品
program update tape 程序更改带
lay ： 指小心地把人或物平放或横放，侧重动作安稳。
place ： 较正式用词，指把某物放在一个正确的位置上，侧重动作的正确。
put ： 普通用词，含义较广泛。指把人或物置于某处，并将其留在该处。
set ： 普通用词，指为了某种目的而将人或物放在一定位置上。指物是多指立着放。

sentence.Network_en: A changing world has put pressures on the company.
sentence.Network_cn: 日新月异的世界使这家公司感到了压力。

sentence.Network_en: Barry had his nose put out of joint by Lucy's aloof sophistication.
sentence.Network_cn: 露西的冷淡与世故使得巴里十分不快。

sentence.Network_en: Her bed was crisply made, her clothes put away.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的床收拾得很整洁，衣服也收起来了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新概念英语第一册单词表_百度文库 ... air( 使.....通风，换换空气) 7、 put( 放置) 8、 clothes( 衣服) 9、.
七年级英语单词表 ... article 文章 put 放;摆;装 idea 主意;想法.
are we the ones who put itthere ., 是我们把它立在那的吗.
七年级英语单词表 ... article 文章 put 放;摆;装 idea 主意;想法.

list.abs: 初中英语短语大全 ... 65．brush one's teeth 刷牙 67．put on 穿上，戴上 68．take off 脱下，摘下.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... put to (船只顺避风等而)靠岸 put up 举起；安装；张贴 put up with 忍受，容忍(讨厌的人).
大学英语四级常用词组 ... put down 记下；镇压；杀死 put forward 提出(要求、事实等) put in 花费；正式提出.
九年级英语单词表 ... advertisement 广告 put off 推迟；延迟 set up 创建；开办.

jx.jx_en_mean: To change or cause to change direction; go or cause to go from one tack to another.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使…转向：改变方向或使…改变方向；从一个航向转到另一个航向或使从一个航向转到另一个航向

jx.jx_en_mean: To state so as to be understood clearly or accepted readily
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使被理解：陈述以使被清楚地理解或迅速地接受

lj.lj_ly: tried to put her views across during the hearing.
lj.lj_ls: 在听讼过程中试图使她的观点能被清楚地理解

jx.jx_en_mean: To attain or carry through by deceit or trickery.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 搞成：用欺骗或计谋完成或贯彻

lj.lj_ly: put all negative thoughts away.
lj.lj_ls: 抛弃所有消极的思想

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To consume (food or drink) readily and quickly
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 吃掉，喝掉：乐意并很快地吃光或喝光（食物或饮料）

lj.lj_ly: put away the dinner in just a few minutes.
lj.lj_ls: 就在几分钟内吃光了晚餐

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To confine to a mental health facility.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 关进精神病医院

lj.lj_ly: The injured cat was put away.
lj.lj_ls: 这个受伤的猫被杀死了

lj.lj_ly: Put away the tools after work, will you?
lj.lj_ls: 工作结束后请把工具收拾好。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 储存…备用：节约以供后来的使用

lj.lj_ly: My grandmother puts by her fresh vegetables.
lj.lj_ls: 我的祖母把她的新鲜蔬菜搁在一边存下来

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring to an end; repress
jx.jx_cn_mean: 制止，取缔：使变得不起作用

lj.lj_ly: put down a rebellion.
lj.lj_ls: 镇压了一起暴乱

lj.lj_ly: put down rumors.
lj.lj_ls: 制止流言

lj.lj_ly: Her parents put her down for failing the course.
lj.lj_ls: 她的父母因为她考试不及格而批评她

lj.lj_ly: He tried to put down her knowledge of literature.
lj.lj_ls: 他试图贬低她的文学知识

lj.lj_ly: “Many status games seem designed to put down others”(&b{Alvin F. Poussaint})
lj.lj_ls: “许多权位竞争好象是为战胜别人而设计的”(&b{阿尔文F.普森特})

lj.lj_ly: Just put him down as a sneak.
lj.lj_ls: 他被归入鬼鬼祟祟的那一类人

lj.lj_ly: Let's put this disaster down to experience.
lj.lj_ls: 让我们把这次灾难归因于经验不足

jx.jx_en_mean: To consume (food or drink) readily; put away
jx.jx_cn_mean: 吃光，喝光：很容易地吃光或喝光（食物或饮料）；吃光

lj.lj_ly: puts down three big meals a day.
lj.lj_ls: 一天吃掉三顿大餐

lj.lj_ly: Plants put forth new growth in the spring.
lj.lj_ls: 植物在春天里开始新的生长

lj.lj_ly: At least put forth a semblance of effort when you scrub the floor.
lj.lj_ls: 当你擦地板时至少能表现出努力的样子

lj.lj_ly: put forth an idea.
lj.lj_ls: 提出一个想法

lj.lj_ly: put forward a new plan.
lj.lj_ls: 提出一个新计划

jx.jx_en_mean: To make a formal offer of

lj.lj_ly: put in a plea of guilty.
lj.lj_ls: 正式提出犯罪诉讼

lj.lj_ly: He put in a good word for me.
lj.lj_ls: 他插进来为我说了一句好话

jx.jx_en_mean: To spend (time) at a location or job
jx.jx_cn_mean: 花时间：在某一场所或工作上花费（时间）

lj.lj_ly: The inmate had put in six years at hard labor. She put in eight hours behind a desk.
lj.lj_ls: 犯人已经做了六年的苦工。她在花了八小时办公

lj.lj_ly: We put in 20 rows of pine trees.
lj.lj_ls: 我们种植了20排松树

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Nautical} To enter a port or harbor
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【航海】} 进港：进入口岸或港口

lj.lj_ly: The freighter puts in at noon.
lj.lj_ls: 货轮中午时进入港口

jx.jx_cn_mean: 设法使…等待：劝说使…拖延下步行动

lj.lj_ly: put off paying the bills.
lj.lj_ls: 拖延付清帐单

lj.lj_ly: managed to put off the creditors for another week.
lj.lj_ls: 设法说服债主晚一个星期再来

lj.lj_ly: put off a sweater.
lj.lj_ls: 脱下毛衣

jx.jx_en_mean: To repel or repulse, as from bad manners
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使厌恶：使厌恶；使反感，如由于不礼貌

lj.lj_ly: His indifferent attitude has put us off.
lj.lj_ls: 他的冷淡态度使我们对他很反感

lj.lj_ly: put on a coat; put socks on.
lj.lj_ls: 穿上外衣；穿上袜子

lj.lj_ly: put on the brakes.
lj.lj_ls: 刹闸

lj.lj_ly: put on an English accent.
lj.lj_ls: 假装带有英国口音

jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【俚语】} 戏弄：戏弄或使（别人）误入歧途

lj.lj_ly: You're putting me on!
lj.lj_ls: 你在开我的玩笑

lj.lj_ly: put on weight.
lj.lj_ls: 增加体重

lj.lj_ly: put on a variety show.
lj.lj_ls: 举行一次杂耍演出

lj.lj_ly: put out a fire.
lj.lj_ls: 扑灭一场大火

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Nautical} To leave, as a port or harbor; depart.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【航海】} 出航：离开，如口岸或港口；出发

lj.lj_ly: put out a drunk.
lj.lj_ls: 赶走醉汉

lj.lj_ly: put out a weekly newsletter.
lj.lj_ls: 发行时事周刊

lj.lj_ly: Did our early arrival put you out?
lj.lj_ls: 我们提早到达是不是使您很不方便?

lj.lj_ly: I was put out by his attention to the television set.
lj.lj_ls: 我被他对电视节目的关注激怒了

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Vulgar} &I{Slang} To be sexually active. Used of a woman.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【粗俗用语】} &I{【俚语】} 性生活上频繁，尤其用于妇女

jx.jx_en_mean: To put across, especially to deceive
jx.jx_cn_mean: 做成：使承认，尤其是为了欺骗时

lj.lj_ly: tried to put a lie over, but to no avail.
lj.lj_ls: 试图用谎言瞒过去，但没有成功

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring to a successful end

lj.lj_ly: put the project through on time; put through a number of new laws.
lj.lj_ls: 按时完成了项目；通过许多新法律

lj.lj_ly: He put me through a lot of trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 他使我遇到许多麻烦

jx.jx_en_mean: To make a telephone connection for

lj.lj_ly: The operator put me through on the office line.
lj.lj_ls: 接线生给我接通了办公室的电话

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (recorded only in the verbal noun putung), of unknown origin; compare with dialect pote 'to push, thrust' (an early sense of the verb put)

entry.def: When you put something in a particular place or position, you move it into that place or position.

example.ex: Leaphorn put the photograph on the desk...
example.tran: 利普霍恩把照片放在书桌上。

example.ex: She hesitated, then put her hand on Grace's arm...
example.tran: 她犹豫了一下，然后把手放到格雷斯的胳膊上。

entry.def: If you put someone somewhere, you cause them to go there and to stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: Rather than put him in the hospital, she had been caring for him at home...
example.tran: 她没有让他住在医院，而是一直在家里照顾他。

example.ex: I'd put the children to bed.
example.tran: 我会安顿孩子们上床睡觉。

entry.tran: 使处于特定状态（或境地）
entry.def: To put someone or something in a particular state or situation means to cause them to be in that state or situation.

example.ex: This is going to put them out of business...
example.tran: 这将会使他们破产。

example.ex: He was putting himself at risk...
example.tran: 他在使自己处于危险的境地。

entry.def: To put something on people or things means to cause them to have it, or to cause them to be affected by it.

example.ex: The ruling will put extra pressure on health authorities to change working practices and shorten hours...
example.tran: 该判决将给卫生部门施加更多的压力促使其改变工作惯例，缩短工作时间。

example.ex: Be aware of the terrible strain it can put on a child when you expect the best reports...
example.tran: 在期待孩子能取得最好成绩时，要当心这会给他们带来可怕的压力。

entry.def: If you put your trust, faith, or confidence in someone or something, you trust them or have faith or confidence in them.

example.ex: He had decided long ago that he would put his trust in socialism when the time came...
example.tran: 很久以前他就决定时机成熟时会寄希望于社会主义。

example.ex: How much faith should we put in anti-ageing products?
example.tran: 我们对抗衰老产品应该抱有多少信心？

entry.tran: 投入，花费（时间、体力或精力）
entry.def: If you put time, strength, or energy into an activity, you use it in doing that activity.

example.ex: We're not saying that activists should put all their effort and time into party politics...
example.tran: 我们并不是说活动家应该把所有的精力和时间都用到政党政治上。

example.ex: Eleanor did not put much energy into the discussion.
example.tran: 埃莉诺没有为这次讨论花费太多精力。

entry.def: If you put money into a business or project, you invest money in it.

example.ex: Investors should consider putting some money into an annuity...
example.tran: 投资者们应当考虑存一些年金。

example.ex: Put $10,000 into this investment and in 10 years, you'll have almost $18,000.
example.tran: 在这项投资上投入1万美元，10年后就会得到近18,000美元。

entry.def: When you put an idea or remark in a particular way, you express it in that way. You can use expressions like to put it simply and to put it bluntly before saying something when you want to explain how you are going to express it.

example.ex: I had already met Pete a couple of times through — how should I put it — friends in low places...
example.tran: 我已经见过皮特几次了，是通过——怎么说呢——一些社会下层的朋友见的。

example.ex: He doesn't, to put it very bluntly, give a damn about the woman or the baby...
example.tran: 直白地说，他根本不在乎那个女人和那个小孩。

entry.def: When you put a question to someone, you ask them the question.

example.ex: Is this fair? Well, I put that question today to Deputy Counsel Craig Gillen...
example.tran: 这公平吗？我今天向副顾问克雷格·吉伦提出这个问题。

example.ex: He thinks that some workers may be afraid to put questions publicly.
example.tran: 他认为一些工人可能害怕公开提问。

entry.tran: 对（事件）作出说明；提出（意见、建议）
entry.def: If you put a case, opinion, or proposal, you explain it and list the reasons why you support or believe it.

example.ex: He always put his point of view with clarity and with courage...
example.tran: 他总是清楚而勇敢地提出自己的观点。

example.ex: He put the case to the Saudi Foreign Minister...
example.tran: 他把这起事件向沙特外长作了说明。

entry.def: If you put something at a particular value or in a particular category, you consider that it has that value or that it belongs in that category.

example.ex: I would put her age at about 50 or so...
example.tran: 我认为她的年龄在50岁上下。

example.ex: All the more technically advanced countries put a high value on science...
example.tran: 所有技术上较先进的国家都高度重视科学。

entry.def: If you put written information somewhere, you write, type, or print it there.

example.ex: Mary's family were so pleased that they put an announcement in the local paper to thank them...
example.tran: 玛丽的家人很高兴，就在当地的报纸上登了一则启事来感谢他们。

example.ex: I think what I put in that book is now pretty much the agenda for this country...
example.tran: 我认为我在书中写的正是目前该国亟待解决的问题。

entry.def: If someone puts one over on you, they make you do or believe something by telling you things that are not true.

example.ex: He considered himself a crafty man — a man would have to get up very early in the morning to put one over on Alf Tandy.
example.tran: 他觉得自己太狡猾了——为了愚弄一下阿尔夫·坦迪通常得早上很早起床。

entry.def: If you put it to someone that something is true, you suggest that it is true, especially when you think that they will be unwilling to admit this.

example.ex: But I put it to you that they're useless...
example.tran: 但是我告诉你它们是没用的。

example.ex: I put this to Kenyon. 'Absolutely untrue,' he said.
example.tran: 我向凯尼恩指出了这一点。他说：“绝对不是真的。”

entry.def: If you say that something is bigger or better than several other things put together, you mean that it is bigger or has more good qualities than all of those other things if they are added together.

example.ex: London has more pubs and clubs than the rest of the country put together.
example.tran: 伦敦的酒馆和俱乐部比英国其他地区所有的加在一起还要多。

entry.tran: （表示同意、祝贺等的用语）握个手吧
entry.def: You say 'Put it there!' to someone when you are asking them to shake hands with you, because you agree with them or want to congratulate them.

example.ex: Put it there, Pal, put it there!
example.tran: 握个手，老弟，祝贺你！

means.word_mean: 1. the option to sell a given stock (or stock index or commodity future) at a given price before a given date
1. put into a certain place or abstract location;

sentences.sentence: "Set the dogs on the scent of the missing children"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to be in a certain state; cause to be in a certain relation;

sentences.sentence: "That song put me in awful good humor"

means.word_mean: 3. formulate in a particular style or language;

sentences.sentence: "She cast her request in very polite language"
"She put too much emphasis on her the last statement"
"He put all his efforts into this job"
"The teacher put an interesting twist to the interpretation of the story"
"We put the time of arrival at 8 P.M."

means.word_mean: 9. arrange thoughts, ideas, temporal events, etc.;

sentences.sentence: "I put these memories with those of bygone times"

example.en: Frank's really putting on the dog for the big party Friday night.
example.zh: 弗兰克为了星期五晚上的那个大聚会，可真是大肆铺张。

list.explanation: 以训诫或惩罚进行要挟某人

example.en: Why can' t Mayor Barry put the wood to school administrators and demand more caring than this?
example.zh: 为什么巴里市长不能以训诫方式要求学校当局多一点关注呢?

list.explanation: 不理睬某人，对某人冷淡

example.en: She was pretty snooty till we all put the chill on her.
example.zh: 她可真是高傲自大极了，直弄得我们大家都不理睬她。

example.en: I sent him a real snorter, because he really quite put the chill on me.
example.zh: 我寄给他一封措同极为严厉的信，因为他对我实在太冷淡了。

example.en: Moyer had the chill put on Stein.
example.zh: 莫耶尔雇人杀死了斯坦因。

example.en: You put it in the hopper. Let's get this done!
example.zh: 你把这暂搁一边。让我们来完成吧!

example.en: The orchestra put that dance number on the fritz.
example.zh: 乐队把那个舞蹈节目给弃砸了。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)向某人敲诈、勒索钱财

example.en: The hooligan puts peddlers on the stake monthly.
example.zh: 那地头蛇按月向小贩们强索保护费。

example.en: He stopped everything to put a move on that Russian woman.
example.zh: 他把手头的事情都放下来，去向那个俄国女人调情。

example.en: Women are quick to put the freeze on freeloaders.
example.zh: 女人们很快会把那些白吃白喝的寄生虫甩掉的。

list.explanation: 使某人受尽折燃(尤指严加审问)，使某人历尽艰苦

example.en: Students asking for loans are really put through the wringer.
example.zh: 要求贷款的学生确实是备受刁难。

auth_sentence.content: Then we were told to put on our respirators.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then we were told to put on our respirators.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then we were told to put on our respirators.

auth_sentence.content: You might want to put some ointment on that.
auth_sentence.res_content: You might want to put some ointment on that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You might want to put some ointment on that.

auth_sentence.content: We will put up a different one each day.
auth_sentence.res_content: We will put up a different one each day.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We will put up a different one each day.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 肉毒碱；腐胺；四甲烯二胺

sentences.en: The boy forgot where he put his textbook.
sentences.cn: 那男孩忘记把课本放在什么地方了。

sentences.en: I'll put you a chair over there.
sentences.cn: 我在那边给你放一把椅子。

sentences.en: It's a wonderful scheme, and he's just the man to put it into effect.
sentences.cn: 这是一个很好的计划, 而他正是实施这个计划的人选。

means.word_mean: 表达, 叙述, 说明

sentences.en: The councillors put the problem of downtown parking before the mayor.
sentences.cn: 议员们向市长提出了市内停车的问题。

sentences.en: You have put the case clearly.
I'd like to put a question to the speaker.
sentences.cn: 我想向演讲者提个问题。

sentences.en: A short note put the matter right.
sentences.cn: 一封短函把事件解释清楚了。

jushi.english: He is going to put the shot in the game.
How can I put what I felt and thought?
jushi.chinese: 我该怎么表达我的感受和想到的事才好呢?
